title: Pierce Brosnan, 66, looks besotted as he kisses wife Keely Shaye Smith, 56, during Portofino getaway
text:
They recently enjoyed a romantic getaway to Iceland.

And Pierce Brosnan, 66, and his wife Keely Shaye Smith, 56, continued their smitten time abroad in Portofino, Italy where they were seen puckering up for a kiss on Friday.

Looking happy and relaxed, the 007 actor, couldn't peel his attention away from his stunning other half as they took in the local Italian culture.

Besotted: Pierce Brosnan, 66, and his wife Keely Shaye Smith, 56, continued their smitten time abroad in Portofino, Italy where they were seen puckering up for a kiss on Friday

Keely looked sensational for her day of sightseeing, cladding her figure in a chic black dress and wrapping up in a leopard print dress.

Her brunette locks were slicked back into a low ponytail and her youthful features were enhanced with a simple slick of make-up.

Opting for comfort in a pair of white trainers, Keely looked content as she strolled along hand-in-hand with the silver fox.

Pierce continued to live up to his heartthrob reputation in an all-black ensemble which he teamed with matching outerwear.

The besotted pair were relaxed as they spent some quality time such as going for bites to eat at local cafes.

They were also seen visiting various historical sights and shopping for a few items from the Souvenir shop and stopping to take selfies.

The couple first met in 1994 in Mexico and married in 2001 at Ballintubber Abbey in County Mayo, Ireland.

Known for playing James Bond, Pierce starred in the films GoldenEye, Tomorrow Never Dies, The World Is Not Enough and Die Another Day.

With Daniel Craig starring in his final Bond film No Time To Die, Pierce recently spoke about the latest generation of the franchise.

The actor said Daniel's brooding portrayal had to be more serious because the franchise was forced to reinvent the character as 'more muscular' and solemn.

However, in the process, Pierce claimed the series has lost its sense of humour while he spoke about the developments of the franchise over the years.

He told The Rake magazine: 'There had to be humour, I felt. It is different now. They had strong competition and they haven't reinvented it but given it a much more muscular, dynamic twist.

'When I played him you have to let the audience in that this is a fantastic joke – this man, jumping off a motorcycle and catching up a plane, is completely preposterous. But for me you had to let them in.

'That's what I was brought up with. Sean (Connery) did it, Roger (Moore) did it par excellence.'

According to Deadline, Pierce has recently been cast in the new film Eurovision from writers Will Ferrell and Andrew Steele and director David Dobkin.

He'll star in the Netflix comedy alongside Ferrell and Mean Girls star Rachel McAdams.
